node.title: 'We have to filter out the crispy bits': How leftover chip oil will keep EV owners moving across the Nullarbor
node.alt: A drone photograph of a remote roadhouse on the Nullarbor
node.description: EV owners are crowdfunding a fast charger in the middle of the Nullarbor — and it will run on leftover chip oil from the local roadhouse.
node.content:
["Electric vehicle owners will be able to have their hot chips and eat them\u00a0too, with a remote\u00a0West Australian roadhouse planning to install\u00a0fast chargers that run on leftover fryer oil.", "From January, a crowdfunded 50kW DC\u00a0charger at Caiguna Roadhouse in the middle of the Nullarbor will plug the 720-kilometre-wide gap between charging networks being built by the WA and SA governments.", "It will mean\u00a0that when the respective\u00a0\"electric highways\" are completed,\u00a0an EV owner will be able to drive from Sydney to Perth without straying from the network of\u00a0fast-charging stations, or having to stop for more than 90 minutes to recharge.", "But what makes the Caiguna charger unique is the generator fuel.", "Off-grid and unable to afford the up-front cost of\u00a0solar and batteries, the roadhouse will\u00a0generate low-emissions electricity through\u00a0burning something it has been throwing out for years: leftover chip oil.", "", "
EVs crossing the Nullarbor have to recharge from slow AC outlets, which can take all night.(Supplied: PlugShare)
", "\"We've started collecting the fat from the deep fryers,\" Don Waugh, the roadhouse's owner, said.", "\"It's a fantastic idea \u2014\u00a0it's just whether we can get that much oil.\"", "
'We can charge cars with that'
", "Mr Waugh, who lives in the small wheatbelt town of Dowerin outside of Perth,\u00a0owns three Nullarbor roadhouses\u00a0on the\u00a0Eyre Highway.", "For months,\u00a0West Australian EV owners have lobbied Mr Waugh\u00a0to host chargers at one of his roadhouses.", "", "
Don Waugh (left) and Jon Edwards (right) at the Dowerin 'EV muster'.(Supplied: Jon Edwards)
", "But the fuel merchant\u00a0took some convincing, said\u00a0Jon\u00a0Edwards,\u00a0a retired engineer who has been leading the push to \"plug the gap\" in the eastern and western charging networks.", "Then, one day in\u00a0November, 66\u00a0EV owners drove out to Dowerin, where they hosted a barbecue, gave free rides to the public,\u00a0and took the skeptical roadhouse\u00a0owner for his first ever spin in an EV.", "\"He\u00a0scratched his head, went for a drive\u00a0and looked at the charger, and that's when I said to him, 'How much of this oil have you got?'\" Mr Edwards said.", "\"He said, '160 to 200 litres. We throw it in the tip.'", "\"I said, 'You better start saving it up because we can charge cars with that.'\"", "", "
The EV muster comes to Dowerin (population 400).(Supplied: Jon Edwards)
", "
EVs on the Nullarbor? About 'one a month'\u00a0
", "Mr Waugh's account of the day was slightly different.", "\"They weren't crackpots, but they were bloody enthusiasts,\" he said of the hoard of EV owners that descended on Dowerin.", "\"They're so convinced about the future. They can tell you in so many years' time you're going to be driving one of these things.\"", "But he was swayed by the experience.", "\"With all the gizmos on them,\u00a0they absolutely fly,\" he said.", "\"Providing we can replace the revenue lost through fuel sales with EV charging or something, then we're still going to be viable.\"", "In early January, Mr Edwards and several volunteers will haul at least one biofuel EV fast charger\u00a0more than 1,000km from Perth to Caiguna, with the aim of having it functional by January 16.", "\"I've already sent a 1,000-litre tank for them to load up with cooking oil,\" Mr Edwards said.", "\"We have to filter out the crispy bits and settle out the rest for two weeks.\"", "", "
EV owners are crowdfunding to cover the cost of the\u00a0biofuel 50kW DC fast charger.(Supplied: Jon Edwards)
", "For the first few years, at least, there should be more than enough biofuel to power the\u00a0generator.", "\"There's about eight to 10 EVs a year going across the Nullarbor, or a bit less than one a month,\" Mr Edwards said.", "\"We're expecting that to increase once fast charging is out there.\"", "EV owners crossing the Nullarbor currently use\u00a0AC chargers running off roadhouse diesel generators. These chargers have a maximum power rating of between 7 and 11kW, depending on the car, and take\u00a06-10 hours to fully charge a vehicle's\u00a0empty\u00a0battery.", "The 50kW DC fast charger\u00a0will cut the recharge time\u00a0down to about an hour and a half, depending on the size of the car\u00a0battery.", "\"With this charger, you'll be able to grab a burger and a coffee and have a read of a paper, and by that time, you're ready to go,\" Mr Edwards said.", "Mr Waugh said the fast charger\u00a0would be initially free to use.", "\"It's not a revenue-raising thing,\" he said.", "
Nullarbor chargers a 'symbolic link'
", "Fast-charging on the Nullarbor is not a new idea.", "In 2020, the\u00a0government asked a\u00a0team of EV experts at the University of Western Australia\u00a0to prepare a list of potential\u00a0fast-charging sites\u00a0to make up a statewide\u00a0\"electric highway\".", "The experts\u00a0proposed eight 50kW stations along the Nullarbor, including two at Caiguna, for a total cost of about $420,000.", "\"It was more of a symbolic link that you would be able to drive to South Australia if you wanted to,\" said Thomas Braunl, a professor of engineering at UWA and one of the report's authors.", "", "
The UWA team of experts proposed\u00a0four charging sites on the Nullarbor (the row of four black dots in the lower right). Green dots indicate\u00a0existing 150kW chargers, while black, red and yellow dots show the proposed sites for 50kW, 150kW and 350kW chargers respectively.\u00a0(Supplied: UWA REVS Project)
", "In August 2021,\u00a0the state government unveiled a\u00a0$21 million plan to build Australia's longest EV charging network.", "But the Nullarbor was left off the list.", "\"The [state] government pretty much adopted what was suggested [in the UWA report], but a\u00a0few of the routes have been deleted for cost reasons, I assume,\" Professor Braunl said.", "One of the omitted routes\u00a0left\u00a0a 720km-long,\u00a0Nullarbor-sized\u00a0stretch between the eastern edge of WA's fast-charging network\u00a0(at the town of Norseman) and the western edge of South Australia's own\u00a0\"electric highway\" (with a charging station to be built\u00a0near\u00a0the WA border).", "Both states' new charging networks are scheduled to be fully operational by 2024.", "Electric cars have proven\u00a0less popular in WA than elsewhere in Australia, with EVs making up about 0.8\u00a0per cent of new car sales, compared to the nationwide average of about 1.6 per cent.", "The motoring lobby has blamed the lag on WA's vast distances and lack of charging infrastructure.", "", "
Jon Edwards and volunteers will also install two diesel-powered\u00a022kW DC chargers at Balladonia and Madura, about 170km either side of Caiguna.(Supplied: PlugShare)
", "With money now\u00a0being spent on charging stations, and the price of EVs dropping every year, this is expected to change.", "Under current policy settings, EVs will make up about 30 per cent of nationwide new car sales by 2030, which means about\u00a0one in\u00a010 vehicles on the road will need access to public charging infrastructure.", "This includes when crossing the\u00a0Nullarbor, Mr Edwards says.", "\"Heaps of people over east have contacted me about it,\" he said.", "\"I see it as an interim step now to get things moving.\u00a0When there's enough traffic to justify solar and battery, the biofuel generators\u00a0become\u00a0a backup.\"", "
Biofuel solution for remote roadhouses without solar
", "The cost of installing enough solar and batteries to meet the current energy needs of Caiguna has been quoted at about $500,000, Mr Waugh said.", "\"If it gets to around $250,000\u00a0we'll\u00a0look at going to solar, but how far in the future that\u2019ll be that depends on battery technology.\"", "", "
South Australia is building a\u00a0network of\u00a0EV fast chargers up to the WA border.(The Drone Way: Ben Stamatovich)
", "For the moment, the roadhouse gets its electricity from diesel.", "According to Mr Edwards, the leftover chip oil \"biofuel\" used in the fast-charging generator\u00a0is carbon neutral, as it's derived from canola flowers that take CO2 out of the atmosphere.", "Although some experts have called into question the clean energy claims of biofuels, running a generator on used chip fat\u00a0pollutes far less than one that burns\u00a0diesel.", "\"And the fuel is free,\" Mr Edwards added.", "Mr Waugh said he could see that his roadhouse business was going to be \"forced to make changes\" with the switch to EVs.", "\"If the chargers were somewhere down the road, they'd stop at down the road and not at our place,\" he said.", "\"And surely they'll buy something from us.\""]
